head.title: Woman's Body Found Under Bronx Bridge

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Woman's Body Found Under Bronx Bridge
hedline.hl2: Womanâ€™s Body Found Under Bronx Bridge

abstract.p: Body of woman is found inside black bag underneath bridge in Bronx near Van Cortlandt Park (S)

block.p: The body of a woman was found yesterday inside a black bag underneath a bridge in the Bronx, not far from Van Cortlandt Park, the police said.
A police statement described the body, which was ''fully clothed and intact,'' as that of a black woman between the ages of 30 and 40.
The body of a woman was found yesterday inside a black bag underneath a bridge in the Bronx, not far from Van Cortlandt Park, the police said.
The body of a woman was found yesterday inside a black bag underneath a bridge in the Bronx, not far from Van Cortlandt Park, the police said.
A police statement described the body, which was ''fully clothed and intact,'' as that of a black woman between the ages of 30 and 40.
A caller reported the body to 911 about 9:25 a.m.
The bag was under the Fieldston Road entrance to the Henry Hudson Parkway in Frank Shackett Park. The police said they were in the early stages of their investigation.
A spokeswoman for the medical examiner's office said an autopsy to determine the cause of death was scheduled for today.

Correction: April 13, 2007, Friday An article in some copies on Sunday about the discovery of a woman's body under a bridge in a Bronx park misstated the name of the park. It is Frank S. Hackett Park, not Frank Shackett.
